alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Beaverhead, Lemhi Highlands; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 1:49PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ..VERY COLD WEATHER TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... Arctic air will bring much colder weather through Wednesday to eastern Idaho. Lows tonight for many areas will be around zero to 10 above. Colder spots in the eastern highlands will be between zero and ten below. For the Island Park and Centennials, as well as the Arco Desert...lows will be between minus 5 and minus 15. Wind chills for all areas will be below zero. Most valley locations will see wind chills from around minus 5 to minus 20. Higher elevations should see values of minus 15 to minus 30. Highs tomorrow will be in the singles digits for the higher elevations, as well as Island Park down through the Arco Desert. Other valley locations will be around 10 to 20 above zero. Lows will still be very cold Wednesday morning, 10 above to 10 below in the valleys and zero to minus 5 for higher elevations. With temperatures and wind chills this low, frostbite and hypothermia will set in much faster...so dress in layers and protect exposed skin. Pipes may be susceptible to freezing and bursting.
